trans-unit.source: Deploy WebJobs using Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Deploy WebJobs using Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Learn how to deploy Azure WebJobs to Azure App Service Web Apps using Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to deploy Azure WebJobs to Azure App Service Web Apps using Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Deploy WebJobs using Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Deploy WebJobs using Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This topic explains how to use Visual Studio to deploy a Console Application project to a web app in [App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714) as an [Azure WebJob](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=390226).
trans-unit.target: This topic explains how to use Visual Studio to deploy a Console Application project to a web app in [App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714) as an [Azure WebJob](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=390226).

trans-unit.source: For information about how to deploy WebJobs by using the [Azure Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715), see [Run Background tasks with WebJobs](web-sites-create-web-jobs.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about how to deploy WebJobs by using the [Azure Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715), see [Run Background tasks with WebJobs](web-sites-create-web-jobs.md).

trans-unit.source: When Visual Studio deploys a WebJobs-enabled Console Application project, it performs two tasks:
trans-unit.target: When Visual Studio deploys a WebJobs-enabled Console Application project, it performs two tasks:

trans-unit.source: Copies runtime files to the appropriate folder in the web app (*App_Data/jobs/continuous* for continuous WebJobs, *App_Data/jobs/triggered* for scheduled and on-demand WebJobs).
trans-unit.target: Copies runtime files to the appropriate folder in the web app (*App_Data/jobs/continuous* for continuous WebJobs, *App_Data/jobs/triggered* for scheduled and on-demand WebJobs).

trans-unit.source: Sets up [Azure Scheduler jobs](#scheduler) for WebJobs that are scheduled to run at particular times.
trans-unit.target: Sets up [Azure Scheduler jobs](#scheduler) for WebJobs that are scheduled to run at particular times.

trans-unit.source: (This is not needed for continuous WebJobs.)
trans-unit.target: (This is not needed for continuous WebJobs.)

trans-unit.source: A WebJobs-enabled project has the following items added to it:
trans-unit.target: A WebJobs-enabled project has the following items added to it:

trans-unit.source: The [Microsoft.Web.WebJobs.Publish](http://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Web.WebJobs.Publish/) NuGet package.
trans-unit.target: The [Microsoft.Web.WebJobs.Publish](http://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Web.WebJobs.Publish/) NuGet package.

trans-unit.source: A [webjob-publish-settings.json](#publishsettings) file that contains deployment and scheduler settings.
trans-unit.target: A [webjob-publish-settings.json](#publishsettings) file that contains deployment and scheduler settings.

trans-unit.source: Diagram showing what is added to a Console App to enable deployment as a WebJob
trans-unit.target: Diagram showing what is added to a Console App to enable deployment as a WebJob

trans-unit.source: You can add these items to an existing Console Application project or use a template to create a new WebJobs-enabled Console Application project.
trans-unit.target: You can add these items to an existing Console Application project or use a template to create a new WebJobs-enabled Console Application project.

trans-unit.source: You can deploy a project as a WebJob by itself, or link it to a web project so that it automatically deploys whenever you deploy the web project.
trans-unit.target: You can deploy a project as a WebJob by itself, or link it to a web project so that it automatically deploys whenever you deploy the web project.

trans-unit.source: To link projects, Visual Studio includes the name of the WebJobs-enabled project in a [webjobs-list.json](#webjobslist) file in the web project.
trans-unit.target: To link projects, Visual Studio includes the name of the WebJobs-enabled project in a [webjobs-list.json](#webjobslist) file in the web project.

trans-unit.source: Diagram showing WebJob project linking to web project
trans-unit.target: Diagram showing WebJob project linking to web project

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: WebJobs deployment features are available in Visual Studio 2013 when you install Azure SDK version 2.4 or later versions:
trans-unit.target: WebJobs deployment features are available in Visual Studio 2013 when you install Azure SDK version 2.4 or later versions:

trans-unit.source: [Azure SDK for Visual Studio 2013](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=323510&clcid=0x409).
trans-unit.target: [Azure SDK for Visual Studio 2013](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=323510&clcid=0x409).

trans-unit.source: The WebJobs deployment features are also included in [Visual Studio 2013 Update 3](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=397827&clcid=0x409) and later updates.
trans-unit.target: The WebJobs deployment features are also included in [Visual Studio 2013 Update 3](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=397827&clcid=0x409) and later updates.

trans-unit.source: Enable WebJobs deployment for an existing Console Application project
trans-unit.target: Enable WebJobs deployment for an existing Console Application project

trans-unit.source: You have two options:
trans-unit.target: You have two options:

trans-unit.source: [Enable automatic deployment with a web project](#convertlink).
trans-unit.target: [Enable automatic deployment with a web project](#convertlink).

trans-unit.source: Configure an existing Console Application project so that it automatically deploys as a WebJob when you deploy a web project.
trans-unit.target: Configure an existing Console Application project so that it automatically deploys as a WebJob when you deploy a web project.

trans-unit.source: Use this option when you want to run your WebJob in the same web app in which you run the related web application.
trans-unit.target: Use this option when you want to run your WebJob in the same web app in which you run the related web application.

trans-unit.source: [Enable deployment without a web project](#convertnolink).
trans-unit.target: [Enable deployment without a web project](#convertnolink).

trans-unit.source: Configure an existing Console Application project to deploy as a WebJob by itself, with no link to a web project.
trans-unit.target: Configure an existing Console Application project to deploy as a WebJob by itself, with no link to a web project.

trans-unit.source: Use this option when you want to run a WebJob in a web app by itself, with no web application running in the web app.
trans-unit.target: Use this option when you want to run a WebJob in a web app by itself, with no web application running in the web app.

trans-unit.source: You might want to do this in order to be able to scale your WebJob resources independently of your web application resources.
trans-unit.target: You might want to do this in order to be able to scale your WebJob resources independently of your web application resources.

trans-unit.source: Enable automatic WebJobs deployment with a web project
trans-unit.target: Enable automatic WebJobs deployment with a web project

trans-unit.source: Right-click the web project in **Solution Explorer**, and then click **Add** > **Existing Project as Azure WebJob**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the web project in **Solution Explorer**, and then click **Add** > **Existing Project as Azure WebJob**.

trans-unit.source: Existing Project as Azure WebJob
trans-unit.target: Existing Project as Azure WebJob

trans-unit.source: The [Add Azure WebJob](#configure) dialog box appears.
trans-unit.target: The [Add Azure WebJob](#configure) dialog box appears.

trans-unit.source: In the **Project name** drop-down list, select the Console Application project to add as a WebJob.
trans-unit.target: In the **Project name** drop-down list, select the Console Application project to add as a WebJob.

trans-unit.source: Selecting project in Add Azure WebJob dialog
trans-unit.target: Selecting project in Add Azure WebJob dialog

trans-unit.source: Complete the [Add Azure WebJob](#configure) dialog, and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Complete the [Add Azure WebJob](#configure) dialog, and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Enable WebJobs deployment without a web project
trans-unit.target: Enable WebJobs deployment without a web project

trans-unit.source: Right-click the Console Application project in **Solution Explorer**, and then click **Publish as Azure WebJob**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the Console Application project in **Solution Explorer**, and then click **Publish as Azure WebJob**.

trans-unit.source: Publish as Azure WebJob
trans-unit.target: Publish as Azure WebJob

trans-unit.source: The [Add Azure WebJob](#configure) dialog box appears, with the project selected in the **Project name** box.
trans-unit.target: The [Add Azure WebJob](#configure) dialog box appears, with the project selected in the **Project name** box.

trans-unit.source: Complete the [Add Azure WebJob](#configure) dialog box, and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Complete the [Add Azure WebJob](#configure) dialog box, and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: The **Publish Web** wizard appears.
trans-unit.target: The **Publish Web** wizard appears.

trans-unit.source: If you don't want to publish immediately, close the wizard.
trans-unit.target: If you don't want to publish immediately, close the wizard.

trans-unit.source: The settings that you've entered are saved for when you do want to [deploy the project](#deploy).
trans-unit.target: The settings that you've entered are saved for when you do want to [deploy the project](#deploy).

trans-unit.source: Create a new WebJobs-enabled project
trans-unit.target: Create a new WebJobs-enabled project

trans-unit.source: To create a new WebJobs-enabled project, you can use the Console Application project template and enable WebJobs deployment as explained in [the previous section](#convert).
trans-unit.target: To create a new WebJobs-enabled project, you can use the Console Application project template and enable WebJobs deployment as explained in [the previous section](#convert).

trans-unit.source: As an alternative, you can use the WebJobs new-project template:
trans-unit.target: As an alternative, you can use the WebJobs new-project template:

trans-unit.source: Use the WebJobs new-project template for an independent WebJob
trans-unit.target: Use the WebJobs new-project template for an independent WebJob

trans-unit.source: Create a project and configure it to deploy by itself as a WebJob, with no link to a web project.
trans-unit.target: Create a project and configure it to deploy by itself as a WebJob, with no link to a web project.

trans-unit.source: Use this option when you want to run a WebJob in a web app by itself, with no web application running in the web app.
trans-unit.target: Use this option when you want to run a WebJob in a web app by itself, with no web application running in the web app.

trans-unit.source: You might want to do this in order to be able to scale your WebJob resources independently of your web application resources.
trans-unit.target: You might want to do this in order to be able to scale your WebJob resources independently of your web application resources.

trans-unit.source: Use the WebJobs new-project template for a WebJob linked to a web project
trans-unit.target: Use the WebJobs new-project template for a WebJob linked to a web project

trans-unit.source: Create a project that is configured to deploy automatically as a WebJob when a web project in the same solution is deployed.
trans-unit.target: Create a project that is configured to deploy automatically as a WebJob when a web project in the same solution is deployed.

trans-unit.source: Use this option when you want to run your WebJob in the same web app in which you run the related web application.
trans-unit.target: Use this option when you want to run your WebJob in the same web app in which you run the related web application.

trans-unit.source: In the SDK 2.4 release, the WebJobs new-project template isn't much easier than creating a Console Application project and enabling WebJobs deployment.
trans-unit.target: In the SDK 2.4 release, the WebJobs new-project template isn't much easier than creating a Console Application project and enabling WebJobs deployment.

trans-unit.source: In the future, the WebJobs new-project template will be more convenient for [WebJobs SDK](http://www.asp.net/aspnet/overview/developing-apps-with-windows-azure/getting-started-with-windows-azure-webjobs) development, because it will automatically install the appropriate WebJobs SDK NuGet packages.
trans-unit.target: In the future, the WebJobs new-project template will be more convenient for [WebJobs SDK](http://www.asp.net/aspnet/overview/developing-apps-with-windows-azure/getting-started-with-windows-azure-webjobs) development, because it will automatically install the appropriate WebJobs SDK NuGet packages.

trans-unit.source: Until then, you can configure a project to use the WebJobs SDK by installing the packages manually as shown in the [WebJobs SDK tutorial](http://www.asp.net/aspnet/overview/developing-apps-with-windows-azure/getting-started-with-windows-azure-webjobs).
trans-unit.target: Until then, you can configure a project to use the WebJobs SDK by installing the packages manually as shown in the [WebJobs SDK tutorial](http://www.asp.net/aspnet/overview/developing-apps-with-windows-azure/getting-started-with-windows-azure-webjobs).

trans-unit.source: Use the WebJobs new-project template for an independent WebJob
trans-unit.target: Use the WebJobs new-project template for an independent WebJob

trans-unit.source: Click **File** > **New Project**, and then in the **New Project** dialog box click **Cloud** > **Microsoft Azure WebJob**.
trans-unit.target: Click **File** > **New Project**, and then in the **New Project** dialog box click **Cloud** > **Microsoft Azure WebJob**.

trans-unit.source: New Project dialog showing WebJob template
trans-unit.target: New Project dialog showing WebJob template

trans-unit.source: Follow the directions shown earlier to [make the Console Application project an independent WebJobs project](#convertnolink).
trans-unit.target: Follow the directions shown earlier to [make the Console Application project an independent WebJobs project](#convertnolink).

trans-unit.source: Use the WebJobs new-project template for a WebJob linked to a web project
trans-unit.target: Use the WebJobs new-project template for a WebJob linked to a web project

trans-unit.source: Right-click the web project in **Solution Explorer**, and then click **Add** > **New Azure WebJob Project**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the web project in **Solution Explorer**, and then click **Add** > **New Azure WebJob Project**.

trans-unit.source: New Azure WebJob Project menu entry
trans-unit.target: New Azure WebJob Project menu entry

trans-unit.source: The [Add Azure WebJob](#configure) dialog box appears.
trans-unit.target: The [Add Azure WebJob](#configure) dialog box appears.

trans-unit.source: Complete the [Add Azure WebJob](#configure) dialog box, and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Complete the [Add Azure WebJob](#configure) dialog box, and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: The Add Azure WebJob dialog
trans-unit.target: The Add Azure WebJob dialog

trans-unit.source: The **Add Azure WebJob** dialog enables you to enter WebJob name and scheduling settings for your WebJob.
trans-unit.target: The **Add Azure WebJob** dialog enables you to enter WebJob name and scheduling settings for your WebJob.

trans-unit.source: Add Azure WebJob dialog
trans-unit.target: Add Azure WebJob dialog

trans-unit.source: The fields in this dialog correspond to fields on the **New Job** dialog of the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: The fields in this dialog correspond to fields on the **New Job** dialog of the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Run Background tasks with WebJobs](web-sites-create-web-jobs.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Run Background tasks with WebJobs](web-sites-create-web-jobs.md).

trans-unit.source: For a scheduled WebJob (not for continuous WebJobs), Visual Studio creates an [Azure Scheduler](/services/scheduler/) job collection if one doesn't exist yet, and it creates a job in the collection:
trans-unit.target: For a scheduled WebJob (not for continuous WebJobs), Visual Studio creates an [Azure Scheduler](/services/scheduler/) job collection if one doesn't exist yet, and it creates a job in the collection:

trans-unit.source: The scheduler job collection is named *WebJobs-{regionname}* where *{regionname}* refers to the region the web app is hosted in.
trans-unit.target: The scheduler job collection is named *WebJobs-{regionname}* where *{regionname}* refers to the region the web app is hosted in.

trans-unit.source: For example: WebJobs-WestUS.
trans-unit.target: For example: WebJobs-WestUS.

trans-unit.source: The scheduler job is named *{webappname}-{webjobname}*.
trans-unit.target: The scheduler job is named *{webappname}-{webjobname}*.

trans-unit.source: For example: MyWebApp-MyWebJob.
trans-unit.target: For example: MyWebApp-MyWebJob.

trans-unit.source: For information about command-line deployment, see [Enabling Command-line or Continuous Delivery of Azure WebJobs](/blog/2014/08/18/enabling-command-line-or-continuous-delivery-of-azure-webjobs/).
trans-unit.target: For information about command-line deployment, see [Enabling Command-line or Continuous Delivery of Azure WebJobs](/blog/2014/08/18/enabling-command-line-or-continuous-delivery-of-azure-webjobs/).

trans-unit.source: If you configure a **Recurring Job** and set recurrence frequency to a number of minutes, the Azure Scheduler service is not free.
trans-unit.target: If you configure a **Recurring Job** and set recurrence frequency to a number of minutes, the Azure Scheduler service is not free.

trans-unit.source: Other frequencies (hours, days, and so forth) are free.
trans-unit.target: Other frequencies (hours, days, and so forth) are free.

trans-unit.source: If you deploy a WebJob and then decide you want to change the type of WebJob and redeploy, you'll need to delete the webjobs-publish-settings.json file.
trans-unit.target: If you deploy a WebJob and then decide you want to change the type of WebJob and redeploy, you'll need to delete the webjobs-publish-settings.json file.

trans-unit.source: This will make Visual Studio show the publishing options again, so you can change the type of WebJob.
trans-unit.target: This will make Visual Studio show the publishing options again, so you can change the type of WebJob.

trans-unit.source: If you deploy a WebJob and later change the run mode from continuous to non-continuous or vice versa, Visual Studio creates a new WebJob in Azure when you redeploy.
trans-unit.target: If you deploy a WebJob and later change the run mode from continuous to non-continuous or vice versa, Visual Studio creates a new WebJob in Azure when you redeploy.

trans-unit.source: If you change other scheduling settings but leave run mode the same or switch between Scheduled and On Demand, Visual Studio updates the existing job rather than create a new one.
trans-unit.target: If you change other scheduling settings but leave run mode the same or switch between Scheduled and On Demand, Visual Studio updates the existing job rather than create a new one.

trans-unit.source: webjob-publish-settings.json
trans-unit.target: webjob-publish-settings.json

trans-unit.source: When you configure a Console Application for WebJobs deployment, Visual Studio installs the [Microsoft.Web.WebJobs.Publish](http://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Web.WebJobs.Publish/) NuGet package
trans-unit.target: When you configure a Console Application for WebJobs deployment, Visual Studio installs the [Microsoft.Web.WebJobs.Publish](http://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Web.WebJobs.Publish/) NuGet package

trans-unit.source: and stores scheduling information in a *webjob-publish-settings.json* file in the project *Properties* folder of the WebJobs project.
trans-unit.target: and stores scheduling information in a *webjob-publish-settings.json* file in the project *Properties* folder of the WebJobs project.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example of that file:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example of that file:

trans-unit.source: You can edit this file directly, and Visual Studio provides IntelliSense.
trans-unit.target: You can edit this file directly, and Visual Studio provides IntelliSense.

trans-unit.source: The file schema is stored at [http://schemastore.org](http://schemastore.org/schemas/json/webjob-publish-settings.json) and can be viewed there.
trans-unit.target: The file schema is stored at [http://schemastore.org](http://schemastore.org/schemas/json/webjob-publish-settings.json) and can be viewed there.

trans-unit.source: If you configure a **Recurring Job** and set recurrence frequency to a number of minutes, the Azure Scheduler service is not free.
trans-unit.target: If you configure a **Recurring Job** and set recurrence frequency to a number of minutes, the Azure Scheduler service is not free.

trans-unit.source: Other frequencies (hours, days, and so forth) are free.
trans-unit.target: Other frequencies (hours, days, and so forth) are free.

trans-unit.source: webjobs-list.json
trans-unit.target: webjobs-list.json

trans-unit.source: When you link a WebJobs-enabled project to a web project, Visual Studio stores the name of the WebJobs project in a *webjobs-list.json* file in the web project's *Properties* folder.
trans-unit.target: When you link a WebJobs-enabled project to a web project, Visual Studio stores the name of the WebJobs project in a *webjobs-list.json* file in the web project's *Properties* folder.

trans-unit.source: The list may contain multiple WebJobs projects, as shown in the following example:
trans-unit.target: The list may contain multiple WebJobs projects, as shown in the following example:

trans-unit.source: You can edit this file directly, and Visual Studio provides IntelliSense.
trans-unit.target: You can edit this file directly, and Visual Studio provides IntelliSense.

trans-unit.source: The file schema is stored at [http://schemastore.org](http://schemastore.org/schemas/json/webjobs-list.json) and can be viewed there.
trans-unit.target: The file schema is stored at [http://schemastore.org](http://schemastore.org/schemas/json/webjobs-list.json) and can be viewed there.

trans-unit.source: Deploy a WebJobs project
trans-unit.target: Deploy a WebJobs project

trans-unit.source: A WebJobs project that you have linked to a web project deploys automatically with the web project.
trans-unit.target: A WebJobs project that you have linked to a web project deploys automatically with the web project.

trans-unit.source: For information about web project deployment, see [How to deploy to Web Apps](web-sites-deploy.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about web project deployment, see [How to deploy to Web Apps](web-sites-deploy.md).

trans-unit.source: To deploy a WebJobs project by itself, right-click the project in **Solution Explorer**, and click **Publish as Azure WebJob**.
trans-unit.target: To deploy a WebJobs project by itself, right-click the project in **Solution Explorer**, and click **Publish as Azure WebJob**.

trans-unit.source: Publish as Azure WebJob
trans-unit.target: Publish as Azure WebJob

trans-unit.source: For an independent WebJob, the same **Publish Web** wizard that is used for web projects appears, but with fewer settings available to change.
trans-unit.target: For an independent WebJob, the same **Publish Web** wizard that is used for web projects appears, but with fewer settings available to change.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: This article has explained how to deploy WebJobs by using Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: This article has explained how to deploy WebJobs by using Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: For information about how to deploy Azure WebJobs from Visual Studio and by using a continuous delivery process, see [Azure WebJobs - Recommended Resources - Deployment](http://www.asp.net/aspnet/overview/developing-apps-with-windows-azure/azure-webjobs-recommended-resources#deploying).
trans-unit.target: For information about how to deploy Azure WebJobs from Visual Studio and by using a continuous delivery process, see [Azure WebJobs - Recommended Resources - Deployment](http://www.asp.net/aspnet/overview/developing-apps-with-windows-azure/azure-webjobs-recommended-resources#deploying).

trans-unit.source: What's changed
trans-unit.target: What's changed

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: [Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714)
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: [Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714)

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change of the Azure portal to the Azure preview portal see: [Reference for navigating the preview portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715)
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change of the Azure portal to the Azure preview portal see: [Reference for navigating the preview portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715)

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
